document_title: Viral fever: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content: If a viral infection leads to fever, is there a risk of complications? Although usually the symptoms will subside within 1-2 weeks. However, there are still cases of viral infections that cause serious complications such as: dehydration, hallucinations/delirium, coma, seizures, kidney failure, liver failure, respiratory fever or multi-organ failure. , sepsis.
subsection_title: sot sieu vi.json. Complications of viral fever
subsection_data:
sot sieu vi.json. Complications of viral fever
If a viral infection leads to fever, is there a risk of complications? Although usually the symptoms will subside within 1-2 weeks. However, there are still cases of viral infections that cause serious complications such as: dehydration, hallucinations/delirium, coma, seizures, kidney failure, liver failure, respiratory fever or multi-organ failure. , sepsis.
